content: 12 arrested in 'very serious' terror plot in UK (CNN) -- British police Wednesday arrested 12 people in a counterterrorism operation, and locations were being searched, authorities said. Arrests were carried out in a series of raids in northwest England, police said. Participating agencies included Merseyside Police, Greater Manchester Police and the Lancashire Constabulary, according to a statement from Greater Manchester Police. The men arrested were involved in a "very serious" plot closely associated with al Qaeda and escaped al Qaeda operative Rashid Rauf, whom British intelligence have linked to the 2006 plot to blow up trans-Atlantic airliners, according to a security source with knowledge of the investigation. Full report at > >http://www.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/europe/04/08/uk.terror.arrests/index.html

title: 12 arrested in 'very serious' terror plot in UK

content: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: Agreed. I didn't buy that story about the "Highly ranked and powerfully placed" intel official who "accidentally" exposed a covert plan to move on terrorists in Britian... Sounds like a bunch of crap to me... Police chief quits over blunder Britain's top counter-terrorism officer has quit after admitting he could have jeopardised an operation to thwart a possible UK al-Qaeda terror plot. Assistant Commissioner Bob Quick resigned after he accidently revealed a secret document to photographers. Police were forced to bring their operation forward and arrested 12 men - 11 of whom are Pakistanis. Gordon Brown said Mr Quick had said sorry for what went wrong and he had thanked him for his long service. >http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/7991307.stm

content: quote: Originally posted by IHAWKER: quote: Originally posted by Irwin_R_Schyster: Agreed. I didn't buy that story about the "Highly ranked and powerfully placed" intel official who "accidentally" exposed a covert plan to move on terrorists in Britian... Sounds like a bunch of crap to me... Police chief quits over blunder Britain's top counter-terrorism officer has quit after admitting he could have jeopardised an operation to thwart a possible UK al-Qaeda terror plot. Assistant Commissioner Bob Quick resigned after he accidently revealed a secret document to photographers. Police were forced to bring their operation forward and arrested 12 men - 11 of whom are Pakistanis. Gordon Brown said Mr Quick had said sorry for what went wrong and he had thanked him for his long service. >http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/7991307.stm Since 2005, England has introduced a series of Police State laws that we Americans who battle to save the Constitution can hardly imagine. Mind you, this is the "home" of Magna Carta. So in todays England, you can be imprisoned for ten years, if you take a photograph, or collect information which "could be useful to terrorists." What exactely does that mean? You can be arrested for a parking ticket, if the officer chooses to do so, and your DNA will then be taken. At the moment, over 7 percent of Brits have their DNA on file. You have a right to take photographs anywhere, unless the local cop deems you are in some manner a menace. All undefined. How can the above laws be justified to a free people? So in this case we are discussing, the Police arrested a bunch of people - And they have announced that they seized important evidence - Photographs of public places. So far, that's all the "proof" they have given the public. Strangely enough, you can get the same photographs and MORE, merely by going to Google Earth. This case stinks. Within a few months, the Brits will introduce more laws, and pretty soon we wont be forced to listen to embarrasing stories about law enforecment and their brutality/incompetence. Such stories will be deemed a menace to the country... Dave

content: Fortunately the innocence or guilt of a person is tried in a court and not in the media. The proof being provided to the public should only be done in court. Most of the media and public see one of many pieces of a case and assume to know all. Based on what has been released there are alot of ASS U M(E)tions going on.
